[External]: The email below came from outside Westfield. Report suspicious email by clicking the Outlook Report Phish button or by forwarding the email to Phishing@Westfieldgrp.com



Sorry for longer than planned delay.

I have completed testing. We can modify the SA_AIC_Resources table

So if its 1 to 1 move like shares aren't moving depth just moving servers but staying at the same level.

UPDATE sa_aic_resources
SET Value = REPLACE(Value, '\NZIMMER-FS', '\New nzimmer-fs')
WHERE Value LIKE '\NZIMMER-FS%';

This will work.

Now if some shares end up in different depths we will have to know the updated path and edit our script.


Thanks,

Nicholas Zimmer
Technical Support Engineer Tier II

Hello Jason,

So finally got a few answers.

Mainly. We will have to modify scans to target the new Isilon, which as long as nodes are set up as expected. It will continue to scan like it currently does. Assuming everything is migrated and data and permissions are there.

As far as the AIC reviews are concerned we need to see how the SA_AIC_Resources table is set up.The UNC paths on the resource, if they will remain the same, will still work fine post migration.

If they would change then we would have to script something up to update all of those reviews to match the new UNC path.
Here is an example from our labs.

[cid:image002.png@01DB927B.5E9C35D0]

This is a windows host so \bwest-fs is the part that needs to stay the same post migration to allow the reviews to remain valid.

Do we know if that UNC path would change to the shares on the Isilon?

Thanks,

Nicholas Zimmer
Technical Support Engineer Tier II

--------------- Original Message ---------------
From: Netwrix Support [techsupport@netwrix.com]
Sent: 2/12/2025 10:43 AM
To: jasongray@westfieldgrp.com; coreysilver@westfieldgrp.com
Subject: RE: NEA - Switching active scanning nodes on Dell Isilon using the EMC Isilon plugin [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0LV5qX:ref ]

Hi Jason and Corey,

1) Our Tier 2 TSE would like to review your environment.

2) As long as the node name is the same we could keep things going (when switching from one data center to the new one) but if you migrate and rename (or re-point to a new URL?), it will be treated as a new server and there isn't a reasonable way to migrate our data from one name to the new name.
We could retain the old data then drop it when the new name has enough data.

3) We can try to collect once a week, but don't advise that due to how long it may take to import but this depends on the environment.
Take this statement with a grain of salt as you are already doing this correct?


Below is a summary of our meeting today:

+++++
2025_0212: Meeting with Jason and Corey
+++++

1) Do we have any customers who are just scanning backup nodes (a 'passive node' that may be one day behind in data). The customer is asking if they can capture the activity data of a synched node - a passive node and not an active node. And they are switching from the active node to the passive node.

2) How does NEA handle a new URL switching from Westfield to Akron but it will be the same data? It is technically a new array but the same data. How does NEA handle that transition as their Akron data center has always had the same data as Westfield (but passive versus active) Currently Isilon does not scan the passive node right now at all.

The passive node is a day behind in terms of replication. It will be a new URL but all of the same data.

3) They scan once a week to capture all file activities.

+++++
Current data center configuration:
+++++
Westfield, OH - Active Data Center - will be deactivated
Akron, OH - Passive Data Center -

+++++
Switching to or migration to:
+++++
Akron, OH - will become the new Active Data Center
Pittsburgh, PA - will become the new Passive Data Center



Thank you,
Mike Candon
Senior Technical Support Engineer

As far as the AIC reviews are concerned we need to see how the SA_AIC_Resources table is set up.The UNC paths on the resource, if they will remain the same, will still work fine post migration.

Hi Jason and Corey,

1) Our Tier 2 TSE would like to review your environment.

2) As long as the node name is the same we could keep things going (when switching from one data center to the new one) but if you migrate and rename (or re-point to a new URL?), it will be treated as a new server and there isn't a reasonable way to migrate our data from one name to the new name.
We could retain the old data then drop it when the new name has enough data.

3) We can try to collect once a week, but don't advise that due to how long it may take to import but this depends on the environment.
Take this statement with a grain of salt as you are already doing this correct?


Below is a summary of our meeting today:

+++++
2025_0212: Meeting with Jason and Corey
+++++

1) Do we have any customers who are just scanning backup nodes (a 'passive node' that may be one day behind in data). The customer is asking if they can capture the activity data of a synched node - a passive node and not an active node. And they are switching from the active node to the passive node.

2) How does NEA handle a new URL switching from Westfield to Akron but it will be the same data? It is technically a new array but the same data. How does NEA handle that transition as their Akron data center has always had the same data as Westfield (but passive versus active) Currently Isilon does not scan the passive node right now at all.

The passive node is a day behind in terms of replication. It will be a new URL but all of the same data.

3) They scan once a week to capture all file activities.

+++++
Current data center configuration:
+++++
Westfield, OH - Active Data Center - will be deactivated
Akron, OH - Passive Data Center -

+++++
Switching to or migration to:
+++++
Akron, OH - will become the new Active Data Center
Pittsburgh, PA - will become the new Passive Data Center

Sorry for longer than planned delay.

I have completed testing. We can modify the SA_AIC_Resources table

So if its 1 to 1 move like shares aren't moving depth just moving servers but staying at the same level.

UPDATE sa_aic_resources
SET Value = REPLACE(Value, '\NZIMMER-FS', '\New nzimmer-fs')
WHERE Value LIKE '\NZIMMER-FS%';

This will work.

Now if some shares end up in different depths we will have to know the updated path and edit our script.
 

Thanks,

Subject: RE: NEA - Switching active scanning nodes on Dell Isilon using the EMC Isilon plugin [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0LV5qX:ref ]

Hi Jason and Corey,

1) Our Tier 2 TSE would like to review your environment.

2) As long as the node name is the same we could keep things going (when switching from one data center to the new one) but if you migrate and rename (or re-point to a new URL?), it will be treated as a new server and there isn't a reasonable way to migrate our data from one name to the new name.
We could retain the old data then drop it when the new name has enough data.

3) We can try to collect once a week, but don't advise that due to how long it may take to import but this depends on the environment.
Take this statement with a grain of salt as you are already doing this correct?


Below is a summary of our meeting today:

+++++
2025_0212: Meeting with Jason and Corey
+++++

1) Do we have any customers who are just scanning backup nodes (a 'passive node' that may be one day behind in data). The customer is asking if they can capture the activity data of a synched node - a passive node and not an active node. And they are switching from the active node to the passive node.

2) How does NEA handle a new URL switching from Westfield to Akron but it will be the same data? It is technically a new array but the same data. How does NEA handle that transition as their Akron data center has always had the same data as Westfield (but passive versus active) Currently Isilon does not scan the passive node right now at all.

The passive node is a day behind in terms of replication. It will be a new URL but all of the same data.

3) They scan once a week to capture all file activities.

+++++
Current data center configuration:
+++++
Westfield, OH - Active Data Center - will be deactivated
Akron, OH - Passive Data Center -

+++++
Switching to or migration to:
+++++
Akron, OH - will become the new Active Data Center
Pittsburgh, PA - will become the new Passive Data Center



Thank you,
Mike Candon
Senior Technical Support Engineer

2) As long as the node name is the same we could keep things going (when switching from one data center to the new one) but if you migrate and rename (or re-point to a new URL?), it will be treated as a new server and there isn't a reasonable way to migrate our data from one name to the new name.

Below is a summary of our meeting today:

+++++
2025_0212: Meeting with Jason and Corey
+++++

1) Do we have any customers who are just scanning backup nodes (a 'passive node' that may be one day behind in data). The customer is asking if they can capture the activity data of a synched node - a passive node and not an active node. And they are switching from the active node to the passive node.

2) How does NEA handle a new URL switching from Westfield to Akron but it will be the same data? It is technically a new array but the same data. How does NEA handle that transition as their Akron data center has always had the same data as Westfield (but passive versus active) Currently Isilon does not scan the passive node right now at all.

The passive node is a day behind in terms of replication. It will be a new URL but all of the same data.

3) They scan once a week to capture all file activities.

+++++
Current data center configuration: 
+++++
Westfield, OH - Active Data Center - will be deactivated
Akron, OH - Passive Data Center -

+++++

Sorry for longer than planned delay.

I have completed testing. We can modify the SA_AIC_Resources table

So if its 1 to 1 move like shares aren't moving depth just moving servers but staying at the same level.

UPDATE sa_aic_resources
SET Value = REPLACE(Value, '\NZIMMER-FS', '\New nzimmer-fs')
WHERE Value LIKE '\NZIMMER-FS%';

This will work.

Now if some shares end up in different depths we will have to know the updated path and edit our script.

Sorry for longer than planned delay.

I have completed testing. We can modify the SA_AIC_Resources table

So if its 1 to 1 move like shares aren't moving depth just moving servers but staying at the same level.

UPDATE sa_aic_resources
SET Value = REPLACE(Value, '\NZIMMER-FS', '\New nzimmer-fs')
WHERE Value LIKE '\NZIMMER-FS%';

This will work.

Now if some shares end up in different depths we will have to know the updated path and edit our script.
 

Thanks,

From: Netwrix Support [techsupport@netwrix.com]

Subject: RE: NEA - Switching active scanning nodes on Dell Isilon using the EMC Isilon plugin [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0LV5qX:ref ]

Hi Jason and Corey,

1) Our Tier 2 TSE would like to review your environment.

2) As long as the node name is the same we could keep things going (when switching from one data center to the new one) but if you migrate and rename (or re-point to a new URL?), it will be treated as a new server and there isn't a reasonable way to migrate our data from one name to the new name. 
We could retain the old data then drop it when the new name has enough data.

3) We can try to collect once a week, but don't advise that due to how long it may take to import but this depends on the environment.
Take this statement with a grain of salt as you are already doing this correct?
 

Below is a summary of our meeting today:

+++++
2025_0212: Meeting with Jason and Corey
+++++

1) Do we have any customers who are just scanning backup nodes (a 'passive node' that may be one day behind in data). The customer is asking if they can capture the activity data of a synched node - a passive node and not an active node. And they are switching from the active node to the passive node.

2) How does NEA handle a new URL switching from Westfield to Akron but it will be the same data? It is technically a new array but the same data. How does NEA handle that transition as their Akron data center has always had the same data as Westfield (but passive versus active) Currently Isilon does not scan the passive node right now at all.

The passive node is a day behind in terms of replication. It will be a new URL but all of the same data.

3) They scan once a week to capture all file activities.

+++++
Current data center configuration: 
+++++
Westfield, OH - Active Data Center - will be deactivated
Akron, OH - Passive Data Center -

+++++
Switching to or migration to:
+++++
Akron, OH - will become the new Active Data Center 
Pittsburgh, PA - will become the new Passive Data Center 




Thank you,
Mike Candon
Senior Technical Support Engineer

www.netwrix.com

TextBody:
Hello Jason,

I believe the DFS will behave just fine from my testing but I am having a hang up on getting the old data for Activity to cooperate.

I am going to try fresh tomorrow after going for circles for several hours throughout today, and am collaborating with another team that believes this should be doable.

I'll update on that front tomorrow.

Alternatively my question is: Why do we need to just move the activity over?

This is how it would play out going that route.
We can preserve the Activity of the current server by just no longer targeting it with NEA. And then we can purge whenever your retention settings dictate.
That data will remain in reports and AIC so you can Still review it. When looking at AIC you will have both servers listed.
If you are looking at Permissions or Current activity we look at the new server. If you want older Activity you look at the old server. 

Any current reports could be filtered to only show current data. 

If I am missing something please let me know, I'll still report on my further testing tomorrow.

Thanks,

Nicholas Zimmer
Technical Support Engineer Tier II

Powerful Data Security Made Easy

Hi Jason and Corey,

1) Our Tier 2 TSE would like to review your environment.

2) As long as the node name is the same we could keep things going (when switching from one data center to the new one) but if you migrate and rename (or re-point to a new URL?), it will be treated as a new server and there isn't a reasonable way to migrate our data from one name to the new name. 
We could retain the old data then drop it when the new name has enough data.

3) We can try to collect once a week, but don't advise that due to how long it may take to import but this depends on the environment.
Take this statement with a grain of salt as you are already doing this correct?
 

Below is a summary of our meeting today:

+++++
2025_0212: Meeting with Jason and Corey
+++++

1) Do we have any customers who are just scanning backup nodes (a 'passive node' that may be one day behind in data). The customer is asking if they can capture the activity data of a synched node - a passive node and not an active node. And they are switching from the active node to the passive node.

2) How does NEA handle a new URL switching from Westfield to Akron but it will be the same data? It is technically a new array but the same data. How does NEA handle that transition as their Akron data center has always had the same data as Westfield (but passive versus active) Currently Isilon does not scan the passive node right now at all.

The passive node is a day behind in terms of replication. It will be a new URL but all of the same data.

3) They scan once a week to capture all file activities.

+++++
Current data center configuration: 
+++++
Westfield, OH - Active Data Center - will be deactivated
Akron, OH - Passive Data Center -

+++++
Switching to or migration to:
+++++
Akron, OH - will become the new Active Data Center 
Pittsburgh, PA - will become the new Passive Data Center 




Thank you,
Mike Candon
Senior Technical Support Engineer

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #434733 -  - NEA - Switching active scanning nodes on Dell Isilon using the EMC Isilon plugin    [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0LV5qX:ref ]

TextBody:
Jason,

I have one more scenario to test to see if it is more efficient  however I did get it to work as is.

I have one ask of you whenever you know the Name of the new server.

This should be done when you can and at least a day prior to implementing the Activity monitor agent  on the New server.
Also disable the FSAC Collection. This will make the transition easier.

Steps and Screenshot below. If you want to meet to do this and discuss the next steps let me know. Otherwise after the new server is ready prior to the New Agent install for activity on the New server. Then We can implement part 2, in order to "move" our activity data from the old server to the new server 

1. In NAM go to the Current FS. and Double click on the File output.
2. Go to the Additional properties tab.
3. Enter the name of the new server the way you will be updating host lists. So if you are using Netbios or FQDN with the current server it makes sense to do the same with the new server.
4. Hit OK.



Thanks,

Nicholas Zimmer
Technical Support Engineer Tier II

____________________ _________
Powerful Data Security Made Easy

6160 Warren Parkway, Suite 100, Frisco, TX 75034
www.netwrix.com

From: Netwrix Support [techsupport@netwrix.com]
Sent: 3/13/2025 5:04 PM
To: jasongray@westfieldgrp.com
Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #434733 - - NEA - Switching active scanning nodes on Dell Isilon using the EMC Isilon plugin [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0LV5qX:ref ]

Hello Jason,

I believe the DFS will behave just fine from my testing but I am having a hang up on getting the old data for Activity to cooperate.

I am going to try fresh tomorrow after going for circles for several hours throughout today, and am collaborating with another team that believes this should be doable.

I'll update on that front tomorrow.

Alternatively my question is: Why do we need to just move the activity over?

This is how it would play out going that route.
We can preserve the Activity of the current server by just no longer targeting it with NEA. And then we can purge whenever your retention settings dictate.
That data will remain in reports and AIC so you can Still review it. When looking at AIC you will have both servers listed.
If you are looking at Permissions or Current activity we look at the new server. If you want older Activity you look at the old server. 

Any current reports could be filtered to only show current data. 

If I am missing something please let me know, I'll still report on my further testing tomorrow.

Thanks,

Nicholas Zimmer
Technical Support Engineer Tier II

Hi Jason and Corey,

1) Our Tier 2 TSE would like to review your environment.

2) As long as the node name is the same we could keep things going (when switching from one data center to the new one) but if you migrate and rename (or re-point to a new URL?), it will be treated as a new server and there isn't a reasonable way to migrate our data from one name to the new name. 
We could retain the old data then drop it when the new name has enough data.

3) We can try to collect once a week, but don't advise that due to how long it may take to import but this depends on the environment.
Take this statement with a grain of salt as you are already doing this correct?
 

Below is a summary of our meeting today:

+++++
2025_0212: Meeting with Jason and Corey
+++++

1) Do we have any customers who are just scanning backup nodes (a 'passive node' that may be one day behind in data). The customer is asking if they can capture the activity data of a synched node - a passive node and not an active node. And they are switching from the active node to the passive node.

2) How does NEA handle a new URL switching from Westfield to Akron but it will be the same data? It is technically a new array but the same data. How does NEA handle that transition as their Akron data center has always had the same data as Westfield (but passive versus active) Currently Isilon does not scan the passive node right now at all.

The passive node is a day behind in terms of replication. It will be a new URL but all of the same data.

3) They scan once a week to capture all file activities.

+++++
Current data center configuration: 
+++++
Westfield, OH - Active Data Center - will be deactivated
Akron, OH - Passive Data Center -

+++++
Switching to or migration to:
+++++
Akron, OH - will become the new Active Data Center 
Pittsburgh, PA - will become the new Passive Data Center

I have one ask of you whenever you know the Name of the new server.

Also disable the FSAC Collection. This will make the transition easier.

Steps and Screenshot below. If you want to meet to do this and discuss the next steps let me know. Otherwise after the new server is ready prior to the New Agent install for activity on the New server. Then We can implement part 2, in order to "move" our activity data from the old server to the new server

1. In NAM go to the Current FS. and Double click on the File output.
2. Go to the Additional properties tab.
3. Enter the name of the new server the way you will be updating host lists. So if you are using Netbios or FQDN with the current server it makes sense to do the same with the new server.
4. Hit OK.

Hello Jason,

So finally got a few answers.

Mainly. We will have to modify scans to target the new Isilon, which as long as nodes are set up as expected. It will continue to scan like it currently does. Assuming everything is migrated and data and permissions are there.

As far as the AIC reviews are concerned we need to see how the SA_AIC_Resources table is set up.The UNC paths on the resource, if they will remain the same, will still work fine post migration.

If they would change then we would have to script something up to update all of those reviews to match the new UNC path.
Here is an example from our labs.

Subject: RE: NEA - Switching active scanning nodes on Dell Isilon using the EMC Isilon plugin [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0LV5qX:ref ]

Hi Jason and Corey,

1) Our Tier 2 TSE would like to review your environment.

2) As long as the node name is the same we could keep things going (when switching from one data center to the new one) but if you migrate and rename (or re-point to a new URL?), it will be treated as a new server and there isn't a reasonable way to migrate our data from one name to the new name.
We could retain the old data then drop it when the new name has enough data.

3) We can try to collect once a week, but don't advise that due to how long it may take to import but this depends on the environment.
Take this statement with a grain of salt as you are already doing this correct?


Below is a summary of our meeting today:

+++++
2025_0212: Meeting with Jason and Corey
+++++

1) Do we have any customers who are just scanning backup nodes (a 'passive node' that may be one day behind in data). The customer is asking if they can capture the activity data of a synched node - a passive node and not an active node. And they are switching from the active node to the passive node.

2) How does NEA handle a new URL switching from Westfield to Akron but it will be the same data? It is technically a new array but the same data. How does NEA handle that transition as their Akron data center has always had the same data as Westfield (but passive versus active) Currently Isilon does not scan the passive node right now at all.

The passive node is a day behind in terms of replication. It will be a new URL but all of the same data.

3) They scan once a week to capture all file activities.

+++++
Current data center configuration:
+++++
Westfield, OH - Active Data Center - will be deactivated
Akron, OH - Passive Data Center -

+++++
Switching to or migration to:
+++++
Akron, OH - will become the new Active Data Center
Pittsburgh, PA - will become the new Passive Data Center



Thank you,
Mike Candon
Senior Technical Support Engineer

Jason,

I have one more scenario to test to see if it is more efficient  however I did get it to work as is.

I have one ask of you whenever you know the Name of the new server.

This should be done when you can and at least a day prior to implementing the Activity monitor agent  on the New server.
Also disable the FSAC Collection. This will make the transition easier.

Steps and Screenshot below. If you want to meet to do this and discuss the next steps let me know. Otherwise after the new server is ready prior to the New Agent install for activity on the New server. Then We can implement part 2, in order to "move" our activity data from the old server to the new server

1. In NAM go to the Current FS. and Double click on the File output.
2. Go to the Additional properties tab.
3. Enter the name of the new server the way you will be updating host lists. So if you are using Netbios or FQDN with the current server it makes sense to do the same with the new server.
4. Hit OK.
[cid:image007.png@01DB9909.284CD180]

Hello Jason,

I believe the DFS will behave just fine from my testing but I am having a hang up on getting the old data for Activity to cooperate.

I am going to try fresh tomorrow after going for circles for several hours throughout today, and am collaborating with another team that believes this should be doable.

I'll update on that front tomorrow.

Alternatively my question is: Why do we need to just move the activity over?

This is how it would play out going that route.
We can preserve the Activity of the current server by just no longer targeting it with NEA. And then we can purge whenever your retention settings dictate.
That data will remain in reports and AIC so you can Still review it. When looking at AIC you will have both servers listed.
If you are looking at Permissions or Current activity we look at the new server. If you want older Activity you look at the old server.

Any current reports could be filtered to only show current data.

If I am missing something please let me know, I'll still report on my further testing tomorrow.

Thanks,

Nicholas Zimmer
Technical Support Engineer Tier II

Sorry for longer than planned delay.

I have completed testing. We can modify the SA_AIC_Resources table

So if its 1 to 1 move like shares aren't moving depth just moving servers but staying at the same level.

UPDATE sa_aic_resources
SET Value = REPLACE(Value, '\NZIMMER-FS', '\New nzimmer-fs')
WHERE Value LIKE '\NZIMMER-FS%';

This will work.

Now if some shares end up in different depths we will have to know the updated path and edit our script.


Thanks,

Subject: RE: NEA - Switching active scanning nodes on Dell Isilon using the EMC Isilon plugin [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0LV5qX:ref ]

Hi Jason and Corey,

1) Our Tier 2 TSE would like to review your environment.

2) As long as the node name is the same we could keep things going (when switching from one data center to the new one) but if you migrate and rename (or re-point to a new URL?), it will be treated as a new server and there isn't a reasonable way to migrate our data from one name to the new name.
We could retain the old data then drop it when the new name has enough data.

3) We can try to collect once a week, but don't advise that due to how long it may take to import but this depends on the environment.
Take this statement with a grain of salt as you are already doing this correct?


Below is a summary of our meeting today:

+++++
2025_0212: Meeting with Jason and Corey
+++++

1) Do we have any customers who are just scanning backup nodes (a 'passive node' that may be one day behind in data). The customer is asking if they can capture the activity data of a synched node - a passive node and not an active node. And they are switching from the active node to the passive node.

2) How does NEA handle a new URL switching from Westfield to Akron but it will be the same data? It is technically a new array but the same data. How does NEA handle that transition as their Akron data center has always had the same data as Westfield (but passive versus active) Currently Isilon does not scan the passive node right now at all.

The passive node is a day behind in terms of replication. It will be a new URL but all of the same data.

3) They scan once a week to capture all file activities.

+++++
Current data center configuration:
+++++
Westfield, OH - Active Data Center - will be deactivated
Akron, OH - Passive Data Center -

+++++
Switching to or migration to:
+++++
Akron, OH - will become the new Active Data Center
Pittsburgh, PA - will become the new Passive Data Center



Thank you,
Mike Candon
Senior Technical Support Engineer

Jason,

I have one more scenario to test to see if it is more efficient  however I did get it to work as is.

I have one ask of you whenever you know the Name of the new server.

This should be done when you can and at least a day prior to implementing the Activity monitor agent  on the New server.
Also disable the FSAC Collection. This will make the transition easier.

Steps and Screenshot below. If you want to meet to do this and discuss the next steps let me know. Otherwise after the new server is ready prior to the New Agent install for activity on the New server. Then We can implement part 2, in order to "move" our activity data from the old server to the new server 

1. In NAM go to the Current FS. and Double click on the File output.
2. Go to the Additional properties tab.
3. Enter the name of the new server the way you will be updating host lists. So if you are using Netbios or FQDN with the current server it makes sense to do the same with the new server.
4. Hit OK.



Thanks,

Nicholas Zimmer
Technical Support Engineer Tier II

Hello Jason,

I believe the DFS will behave just fine from my testing but I am having a hang up on getting the old data for Activity to cooperate.

I am going to try fresh tomorrow after going for circles for several hours throughout today, and am collaborating with another team that believes this should be doable.

I'll update on that front tomorrow.

Alternatively my question is: Why do we need to just move the activity over?

This is how it would play out going that route.
We can preserve the Activity of the current server by just no longer targeting it with NEA. And then we can purge whenever your retention settings dictate.
That data will remain in reports and AIC so you can Still review it. When looking at AIC you will have both servers listed.
If you are looking at Permissions or Current activity we look at the new server. If you want older Activity you look at the old server. 

Any current reports could be filtered to only show current data. 

If I am missing something please let me know, I'll still report on my further testing tomorrow.

Thanks,

Nicholas Zimmer

UPDATE sa_aic_resources
SET Value = REPLACE(Value, '\NZIMMER-FS', '\New nzimmer-fs')
WHERE Value LIKE '\NZIMMER-FS%';

This will work.

Now if some shares end up in different depths we will have to know the updated path and edit our script.
 

Thanks,

Hi Jason and Corey,

1) Our Tier 2 TSE would like to review your environment.

2) As long as the node name is the same we could keep things going (when switching from one data center to the new one) but if you migrate and rename (or re-point to a new URL?), it will be treated as a new server and there isn't a reasonable way to migrate our data from one name to the new name. 
We could retain the old data then drop it when the new name has enough data.

3) We can try to collect once a week, but don't advise that due to how long it may take to import but this depends on the environment.
Take this statement with a grain of salt as you are already doing this correct?
 

Below is a summary of our meeting today:

+++++
2025_0212: Meeting with Jason and Corey
+++++

1) Do we have any customers who are just scanning backup nodes (a 'passive node' that may be one day behind in data). The customer is asking if they can capture the activity data of a synched node - a passive node and not an active node. And they are switching from the active node to the passive node.

2) How does NEA handle a new URL switching from Westfield to Akron but it will be the same data? It is technically a new array but the same data. How does NEA handle that transition as their Akron data center has always had the same data as Westfield (but passive versus active) Currently Isilon does not scan the passive node right now at all.

The passive node is a day behind in terms of replication. It will be a new URL but all of the same data.

3) They scan once a week to capture all file activities.

+++++
Current data center configuration: 
+++++
Westfield, OH - Active Data Center - will be deactivated
Akron, OH - Passive Data Center -

+++++
Switching to or migration to:
+++++
Akron, OH - will become the new Active Data Center 
Pittsburgh, PA - will become the new Passive Data Center 




Thank you,
Mike Candon

Jason,

I have one more scenario to test to see if it is more efficient  however I did get it to work as is.

I have one ask of you whenever you know the Name of the new server.

This should be done when you can and at least a day prior to implementing the Activity monitor agent  on the New server.
Also disable the FSAC Collection. This will make the transition easier.

Steps and Screenshot below. If you want to meet to do this and discuss the next steps let me know. Otherwise after the new server is ready prior to the New Agent install for activity on the New server. Then We can implement part 2, in order to "move" our activity data from the old server to the new server

1. In NAM go to the Current FS. and Double click on the File output.
2. Go to the Additional properties tab.
3. Enter the name of the new server the way you will be updating host lists. So if you are using Netbios or FQDN with the current server it makes sense to do the same with the new server.
4. Hit OK.

Sorry for longer than planned delay.

I have completed testing. We can modify the SA_AIC_Resources table

So if its 1 to 1 move like shares aren't moving depth just moving servers but staying at the same level.

UPDATE sa_aic_resources
SET Value = REPLACE(Value, '\NZIMMER-FS', '\New nzimmer-fs')
WHERE Value LIKE '\NZIMMER-FS%';

This will work.

Now if some shares end up in different depths we will have to know the updated path and edit our script.

Hi Jason and Corey,

1) Our Tier 2 TSE would like to review your environment.

2) As long as the node name is the same we could keep things going (when switching from one data center to the new one) but if you migrate and rename (or re-point to a new URL?), it will be treated as a new server and there isn't a reasonable way to migrate our data from one name to the new name.
We could retain the old data then drop it when the new name has enough data.

3) We can try to collect once a week, but don't advise that due to how long it may take to import but this depends on the environment.
Take this statement with a grain of salt as you are already doing this correct?


Below is a summary of our meeting today:

+++++
2025_0212: Meeting with Jason and Corey
+++++

1) Do we have any customers who are just scanning backup nodes (a 'passive node' that may be one day behind in data). The customer is asking if they can capture the activity data of a synched node - a passive node and not an active node. And they are switching from the active node to the passive node.

2) How does NEA handle a new URL switching from Westfield to Akron but it will be the same data? It is technically a new array but the same data. How does NEA handle that transition as their Akron data center has always had the same data as Westfield (but passive versus active) Currently Isilon does not scan the passive node right now at all.

The passive node is a day behind in terms of replication. It will be a new URL but all of the same data.

3) They scan once a week to capture all file activities.

+++++
Current data center configuration:
+++++
Westfield, OH - Active Data Center - will be deactivated
Akron, OH - Passive Data Center -

+++++
Switching to or migration to:
+++++
Akron, OH - will become the new Active Data Center
Pittsburgh, PA - will become the new Passive Data Center



Thank you,
Mike Candon
Senior Technical Support Engineer

Jason,

I have one more scenario to test to see if it is more efficient  however I did get it to work as is.

I have one ask of you whenever you know the Name of the new server.

This should be done when you can and at least a day prior to implementing the Activity monitor agent  on the New server.
Also disable the FSAC Collection. This will make the transition easier.

Steps and Screenshot below. If you want to meet to do this and discuss the next steps let me know. Otherwise after the new server is ready prior to the New Agent install for activity on the New server. Then We can implement part 2, in order to "move" our activity data from the old server to the new server 

1. In NAM go to the Current FS. and Double click on the File output.
2. Go to the Additional properties tab.
3. Enter the name of the new server the way you will be updating host lists. So if you are using Netbios or FQDN with the current server it makes sense to do the same with the new server.
4. Hit OK.



Thanks,

Hello Jason,

I believe the DFS will behave just fine from my testing but I am having a hang up on getting the old data for Activity to cooperate.

I am going to try fresh tomorrow after going for circles for several hours throughout today, and am collaborating with another team that believes this should be doable.

I'll update on that front tomorrow.

Alternatively my question is: Why do we need to just move the activity over?

This is how it would play out going that route.
We can preserve the Activity of the current server by just no longer targeting it with NEA. And then we can purge whenever your retention settings dictate.
That data will remain in reports and AIC so you can Still review it. When looking at AIC you will have both servers listed.
If you are looking at Permissions or Current activity we look at the new server. If you want older Activity you look at the old server. 

Any current reports could be filtered to only show current data. 

If I am missing something please let me know, I'll still report on my further testing tomorrow.

Thanks,

Nicholas Zimmer

Hi Jason and Corey,

1) Our Tier 2 TSE would like to review your environment.

2) As long as the node name is the same we could keep things going (when switching from one data center to the new one) but if you migrate and rename (or re-point to a new URL?), it will be treated as a new server and there isn't a reasonable way to migrate our data from one name to the new name. 
We could retain the old data then drop it when the new name has enough data.

3) We can try to collect once a week, but don't advise that due to how long it may take to import but this depends on the environment.
Take this statement with a grain of salt as you are already doing this correct?
 

Below is a summary of our meeting today:

+++++
2025_0212: Meeting with Jason and Corey
+++++

1) Do we have any customers who are just scanning backup nodes (a 'passive node' that may be one day behind in data). The customer is asking if they can capture the activity data of a synched node - a passive node and not an active node. And they are switching from the active node to the passive node.

2) How does NEA handle a new URL switching from Westfield to Akron but it will be the same data? It is technically a new array but the same data. How does NEA handle that transition as their Akron data center has always had the same data as Westfield (but passive versus active) Currently Isilon does not scan the passive node right now at all.

The passive node is a day behind in terms of replication. It will be a new URL but all of the same data.

3) They scan once a week to capture all file activities.

+++++
Current data center configuration: 
+++++
Westfield, OH - Active Data Center - will be deactivated
Akron, OH - Passive Data Center -

+++++
Switching to or migration to:
+++++
Akron, OH - will become the new Active Data Center 
Pittsburgh, PA - will become the new Passive Data Center 




Thank you,

Jason,

I have one more scenario to test to see if it is more efficient  however I did get it to work as is.

I have one ask of you whenever you know the Name of the new server.

This should be done when you can and at least a day prior to implementing the Activity monitor agent  on the New server.
Also disable the FSAC Collection. This will make the transition easier.

Steps and Screenshot below. If you want to meet to do this and discuss the next steps let me know. Otherwise after the new server is ready prior to the New Agent install for activity on the New server. Then We can implement part 2, in order to "move" our activity data from the old server to the new server

1. In NAM go to the Current FS. and Double click on the File output.
2. Go to the Additional properties tab.
3. Enter the name of the new server the way you will be updating host lists. So if you are using Netbios or FQDN with the current server it makes sense to do the same with the new server.
4. Hit OK.
[cid:image006.png@01DB9CB7.BF3150B0]

Hello Jason,

I believe the DFS will behave just fine from my testing but I am having a hang up on getting the old data for Activity to cooperate.

I am going to try fresh tomorrow after going for circles for several hours throughout today, and am collaborating with another team that believes this should be doable.

I'll update on that front tomorrow.

Alternatively my question is: Why do we need to just move the activity over?

This is how it would play out going that route.
We can preserve the Activity of the current server by just no longer targeting it with NEA. And then we can purge whenever your retention settings dictate.
That data will remain in reports and AIC so you can Still review it. When looking at AIC you will have both servers listed.
If you are looking at Permissions or Current activity we look at the new server. If you want older Activity you look at the old server.

Any current reports could be filtered to only show current data.

If I am missing something please let me know, I'll still report on my further testing tomorrow.

Thanks,

Sorry for longer than planned delay.

I have completed testing. We can modify the SA_AIC_Resources table

So if its 1 to 1 move like shares aren't moving depth just moving servers but staying at the same level.

UPDATE sa_aic_resources
SET Value = REPLACE(Value, '\NZIMMER-FS', '\New nzimmer-fs')
WHERE Value LIKE '\NZIMMER-FS%';

This will work.

Now if some shares end up in different depths we will have to know the updated path and edit our script.

From: Netwrix Support [techsupport@netwrix.com]

Subject: RE: NEA - Switching active scanning nodes on Dell Isilon using the EMC Isilon plugin [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0LV5qX:ref ]

Hi Jason and Corey,

1) Our Tier 2 TSE would like to review your environment.

2) As long as the node name is the same we could keep things going (when switching from one data center to the new one) but if you migrate and rename (or re-point to a new URL?), it will be treated as a new server and there isn't a reasonable way to migrate our data from one name to the new name.
We could retain the old data then drop it when the new name has enough data.

3) We can try to collect once a week, but don't advise that due to how long it may take to import but this depends on the environment.
Take this statement with a grain of salt as you are already doing this correct?


Below is a summary of our meeting today:

+++++
2025_0212: Meeting with Jason and Corey
+++++

1) Do we have any customers who are just scanning backup nodes (a 'passive node' that may be one day behind in data). The customer is asking if they can capture the activity data of a synched node - a passive node and not an active node. And they are switching from the active node to the passive node.

2) How does NEA handle a new URL switching from Westfield to Akron but it will be the same data? It is technically a new array but the same data. How does NEA handle that transition as their Akron data center has always had the same data as Westfield (but passive versus active) Currently Isilon does not scan the passive node right now at all.

The passive node is a day behind in terms of replication. It will be a new URL but all of the same data.

3) They scan once a week to capture all file activities.

+++++
Current data center configuration:
+++++
Westfield, OH - Active Data Center - will be deactivated
Akron, OH - Passive Data Center -

+++++
Switching to or migration to:
+++++
Akron, OH - will become the new Active Data Center
Pittsburgh, PA - will become the new Passive Data Center



Thank you,
Mike Candon
Senior Technical Support Engineer

Jason,

I have one more scenario to test to see if it is more efficient  however I did get it to work as is.

I have one ask of you whenever you know the Name of the new server.

This should be done when you can and at least a day prior to implementing the Activity monitor agent  on the New server.
Also disable the FSAC Collection. This will make the transition easier.

Steps and Screenshot below. If you want to meet to do this and discuss the next steps let me know. Otherwise after the new server is ready prior to the New Agent install for activity on the New server. Then We can implement part 2, in order to "move" our activity data from the old server to the new server

2. Go to the Additional properties tab.

4. Hit OK.

We can preserve the Activity of the current server by just no longer targeting it with NEA. And then we can purge whenever your retention settings dictate.

If you are looking at Permissions or Current activity we look at the new server. If you want older Activity you look at the old server.

Sorry for longer than planned delay.

I have completed testing. We can modify the SA_AIC_Resources table

So if its 1 to 1 move like shares aren't moving depth just moving servers but staying at the same level.

UPDATE sa_aic_resources
SET Value = REPLACE(Value, '\NZIMMER-FS', '\New nzimmer-fs')
WHERE Value LIKE '\NZIMMER-FS%';

This will work.

Now if some shares end up in different depths we will have to know the updated path and edit our script.

Subject: RE: NEA - Switching active scanning nodes on Dell Isilon using the EMC Isilon plugin [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0LV5qX:ref ]

Hi Jason and Corey,

1) Our Tier 2 TSE would like to review your environment.

2) As long as the node name is the same we could keep things going (when switching from one data center to the new one) but if you migrate and rename (or re-point to a new URL?), it will be treated as a new server and there isn't a reasonable way to migrate our data from one name to the new name. 
We could retain the old data then drop it when the new name has enough data.

3) We can try to collect once a week, but don't advise that due to how long it may take to import but this depends on the environment.
Take this statement with a grain of salt as you are already doing this correct?
 

Below is a summary of our meeting today:

+++++
2025_0212: Meeting with Jason and Corey
+++++

1) Do we have any customers who are just scanning backup nodes (a 'passive node' that may be one day behind in data). The customer is asking if they can capture the activity data of a synched node - a passive node and not an active node. And they are switching from the active node to the passive node.

2) How does NEA handle a new URL switching from Westfield to Akron but it will be the same data? It is technically a new array but the same data. How does NEA handle that transition as their Akron data center has always had the same data as Westfield (but passive versus active) Currently Isilon does not scan the passive node right now at all.

The passive node is a day behind in terms of replication. It will be a new URL but all of the same data.

3) They scan once a week to capture all file activities.

+++++
Current data center configuration: 
+++++
Westfield, OH - Active Data Center - will be deactivated
Akron, OH - Passive Data Center -

+++++
Switching to or migration to:
+++++
Akron, OH - will become the new Active Data Center 
Pittsburgh, PA - will become the new Passive Data Center 




Thank you,
Mike Candon
Senior Technical Support Engineer

Subject: RE: NEA - Switching active scanning nodes on Dell Isilon using the EMC Isilon plugin [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0LV5qX:ref ]

Hi Jason and Corey,

1) Our Tier 2 TSE would like to review your environment.

2) As long as the node name is the same we could keep things going (when switching from one data center to the new one) but if you migrate and rename (or re-point to a new URL?), it will be treated as a new server and there isn't a reasonable way to migrate our data from one name to the new name.
We could retain the old data then drop it when the new name has enough data.

3) We can try to collect once a week, but don't advise that due to how long it may take to import but this depends on the environment.
Take this statement with a grain of salt as you are already doing this correct?


Below is a summary of our meeting today:

+++++
2025_0212: Meeting with Jason and Corey
+++++

1) Do we have any customers who are just scanning backup nodes (a 'passive node' that may be one day behind in data). The customer is asking if they can capture the activity data of a synched node - a passive node and not an active node. And they are switching from the active node to the passive node.

2) How does NEA handle a new URL switching from Westfield to Akron but it will be the same data? It is technically a new array but the same data. How does NEA handle that transition as their Akron data center has always had the same data as Westfield (but passive versus active) Currently Isilon does not scan the passive node right now at all.

The passive node is a day behind in terms of replication. It will be a new URL but all of the same data.

3) They scan once a week to capture all file activities.

+++++
Current data center configuration:
+++++
Westfield, OH - Active Data Center - will be deactivated
Akron, OH - Passive Data Center -

+++++
Switching to or migration to:
+++++
Akron, OH - will become the new Active Data Center
Pittsburgh, PA - will become the new Passive Data Center



Thank you,
Mike Candon
Senior Technical Support Engineer

Jason,

I have one more scenario to test to see if it is more efficient  however I did get it to work as is.

I have one ask of you whenever you know the Name of the new server.

This should be done when you can and at least a day prior to implementing the Activity monitor agent  on the New server.
Also disable the FSAC Collection. This will make the transition easier.

Steps and Screenshot below. If you want to meet to do this and discuss the next steps let me know. Otherwise after the new server is ready prior to the New Agent install for activity on the New server. Then We can implement part 2, in order to "move" our activity data from the old server to the new server 

1. In NAM go to the Current FS. and Double click on the File output.
2. Go to the Additional properties tab.
3. Enter the name of the new server the way you will be updating host lists. So if you are using Netbios or FQDN with the current server it makes sense to do the same with the new server.
4. Hit OK.



Thanks,

Nicholas Zimmer
Technical Support Engineer Tier II

Hello Jason,

I believe the DFS will behave just fine from my testing but I am having a hang up on getting the old data for Activity to cooperate.

I am going to try fresh tomorrow after going for circles for several hours throughout today, and am collaborating with another team that believes this should be doable.

I'll update on that front tomorrow.

Alternatively my question is: Why do we need to just move the activity over?

This is how it would play out going that route.
We can preserve the Activity of the current server by just no longer targeting it with NEA. And then we can purge whenever your retention settings dictate.
That data will remain in reports and AIC so you can Still review it. When looking at AIC you will have both servers listed.
If you are looking at Permissions or Current activity we look at the new server. If you want older Activity you look at the old server. 

Any current reports could be filtered to only show current data. 

If I am missing something please let me know, I'll still report on my further testing tomorrow.

Thanks,

Nicholas Zimmer
Technical Support Engineer Tier II

Sorry for longer than planned delay.

I have completed testing. We can modify the SA_AIC_Resources table

So if its 1 to 1 move like shares aren't moving depth just moving servers but staying at the same level.

UPDATE sa_aic_resources
SET Value = REPLACE(Value, '\NZIMMER-FS', '\New nzimmer-fs')
WHERE Value LIKE '\NZIMMER-FS%';

This will work.

Now if some shares end up in different depths we will have to know the updated path and edit our script.
 

Thanks,

Nicholas Zimmer

Hi Jason and Corey,

1) Our Tier 2 TSE would like to review your environment.

2) As long as the node name is the same we could keep things going (when switching from one data center to the new one) but if you migrate and rename (or re-point to a new URL?), it will be treated as a new server and there isn't a reasonable way to migrate our data from one name to the new name. 
We could retain the old data then drop it when the new name has enough data.

3) We can try to collect once a week, but don't advise that due to how long it may take to import but this depends on the environment.
Take this statement with a grain of salt as you are already doing this correct?
 

Below is a summary of our meeting today:

+++++
2025_0212: Meeting with Jason and Corey
+++++

1) Do we have any customers who are just scanning backup nodes (a 'passive node' that may be one day behind in data). The customer is asking if they can capture the activity data of a synched node - a passive node and not an active node. And they are switching from the active node to the passive node.

2) How does NEA handle a new URL switching from Westfield to Akron but it will be the same data? It is technically a new array but the same data. How does NEA handle that transition as their Akron data center has always had the same data as Westfield (but passive versus active) Currently Isilon does not scan the passive node right now at all.

The passive node is a day behind in terms of replication. It will be a new URL but all of the same data.

3) They scan once a week to capture all file activities.

+++++
Current data center configuration: 
+++++
Westfield, OH - Active Data Center - will be deactivated
Akron, OH - Passive Data Center -

+++++
Switching to or migration to:
+++++
Akron, OH - will become the new Active Data Center 
Pittsburgh, PA - will become the new Passive Data Center 




Thank you,

Jason,

I have one more scenario to test to see if it is more efficient  however I did get it to work as is.

I have one ask of you whenever you know the Name of the new server.

This should be done when you can and at least a day prior to implementing the Activity monitor agent  on the New server.
Also disable the FSAC Collection. This will make the transition easier.

Steps and Screenshot below. If you want to meet to do this and discuss the next steps let me know. Otherwise after the new server is ready prior to the New Agent install for activity on the New server. Then We can implement part 2, in order to "move" our activity data from the old server to the new server

1. In NAM go to the Current FS. and Double click on the File output.
2. Go to the Additional properties tab.
3. Enter the name of the new server the way you will be updating host lists. So if you are using Netbios or FQDN with the current server it makes sense to do the same with the new server.
4. Hit OK.

Alternatively my question is: Why do we need to just move the activity over?

We can preserve the Activity of the current server by just no longer targeting it with NEA. And then we can purge whenever your retention settings dictate.

If you are looking at Permissions or Current activity we look at the new server. If you want older Activity you look at the old server.

Sorry for longer than planned delay.

I have completed testing. We can modify the SA_AIC_Resources table

So if its 1 to 1 move like shares aren't moving depth just moving servers but staying at the same level.

UPDATE sa_aic_resources
SET Value = REPLACE(Value, '\NZIMMER-FS', '\New nzimmer-fs')
WHERE Value LIKE '\NZIMMER-FS%';

This will work.

Now if some shares end up in different depths we will have to know the updated path and edit our script.


Thanks,

--------------- Original Message ---------------
From: Netwrix Support [techsupport@netwrix.com]
Sent: 2/12/2025 10:43 AM
To: jasongray@westfieldgrp.com<mailto:jasongray@westfieldgrp.com>; coreysilver@westfieldgrp.com<mailto:coreysilver@westfieldgrp.com>
Subject: RE: NEA - Switching active scanning nodes on Dell Isilon using the EMC Isilon plugin [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0LV5qX:ref ]

Hi Jason and Corey,

1) Our Tier 2 TSE would like to review your environment.

2) As long as the node name is the same we could keep things going (when switching from one data center to the new one) but if you migrate and rename (or re-point to a new URL?), it will be treated as a new server and there isn't a reasonable way to migrate our data from one name to the new name.
We could retain the old data then drop it when the new name has enough data.

3) We can try to collect once a week, but don't advise that due to how long it may take to import but this depends on the environment.
Take this statement with a grain of salt as you are already doing this correct?


Below is a summary of our meeting today:

+++++
2025_0212: Meeting with Jason and Corey
+++++

1) Do we have any customers who are just scanning backup nodes (a 'passive node' that may be one day behind in data). The customer is asking if they can capture the activity data of a synched node - a passive node and not an active node. And they are switching from the active node to the passive node.

2) How does NEA handle a new URL switching from Westfield to Akron but it will be the same data? It is technically a new array but the same data. How does NEA handle that transition as their Akron data center has always had the same data as Westfield (but passive versus active) Currently Isilon does not scan the passive node right now at all.

The passive node is a day behind in terms of replication. It will be a new URL but all of the same data.

3) They scan once a week to capture all file activities.

+++++
Current data center configuration:
+++++
Westfield, OH - Active Data Center - will be deactivated
Akron, OH - Passive Data Center -

+++++
Switching to or migration to:
+++++
Akron, OH - will become the new Active Data Center
Pittsburgh, PA - will become the new Passive Data Center



Thank you,
Mike Candon
Senior Technical Support Engineer

Hi Jason and Corey,

1) Our Tier 2 TSE would like to review your environment.

2) As long as the node name is the same we could keep things going (when switching from one data center to the new one) but if you migrate and rename (or re-point to a new URL?), it will be treated as a new server and there isn't a reasonable way to migrate our data from one name to the new name. 
We could retain the old data then drop it when the new name has enough data.

3) We can try to collect once a week, but don't advise that due to how long it may take to import but this depends on the environment.
Take this statement with a grain of salt as you are already doing this correct?
 

Below is a summary of our meeting today:

+++++
2025_0212: Meeting with Jason and Corey
+++++

1) Do we have any customers who are just scanning backup nodes (a 'passive node' that may be one day behind in data). The customer is asking if they can capture the activity data of a synched node - a passive node and not an active node. And they are switching from the active node to the passive node.

2) How does NEA handle a new URL switching from Westfield to Akron but it will be the same data? It is technically a new array but the same data. How does NEA handle that transition as their Akron data center has always had the same data as Westfield (but passive versus active) Currently Isilon does not scan the passive node right now at all.

The passive node is a day behind in terms of replication. It will be a new URL but all of the same data.

3) They scan once a week to capture all file activities.

+++++
Current data center configuration: 
+++++
Westfield, OH - Active Data Center - will be deactivated
Akron, OH - Passive Data Center -

+++++
Switching to or migration to:
+++++
Akron, OH - will become the new Active Data Center 
Pittsburgh, PA - will become the new Passive Data Center 




Thank you,

Jason,

I have one more scenario to test to see if it is more efficient  however I did get it to work as is.

I have one ask of you whenever you know the Name of the new server.

This should be done when you can and at least a day prior to implementing the Activity monitor agent  on the New server.
Also disable the FSAC Collection. This will make the transition easier.

Steps and Screenshot below. If you want to meet to do this and discuss the next steps let me know. Otherwise after the new server is ready prior to the New Agent install for activity on the New server. Then We can implement part 2, in order to "move" our activity data from the old server to the new server 

1. In NAM go to the Current FS. and Double click on the File output.
2. Go to the Additional properties tab.
3. Enter the name of the new server the way you will be updating host lists. So if you are using Netbios or FQDN with the current server it makes sense to do the same with the new server.
4. Hit OK.



Thanks,

Nicholas Zimmer
Technical Support Engineer Tier II

Hello Jason,

I believe the DFS will behave just fine from my testing but I am having a hang up on getting the old data for Activity to cooperate.

I am going to try fresh tomorrow after going for circles for several hours throughout today, and am collaborating with another team that believes this should be doable.

I'll update on that front tomorrow.

Alternatively my question is: Why do we need to just move the activity over?

This is how it would play out going that route.
We can preserve the Activity of the current server by just no longer targeting it with NEA. And then we can purge whenever your retention settings dictate.
That data will remain in reports and AIC so you can Still review it. When looking at AIC you will have both servers listed.
If you are looking at Permissions or Current activity we look at the new server. If you want older Activity you look at the old server. 

Any current reports could be filtered to only show current data. 

If I am missing something please let me know, I'll still report on my further testing tomorrow.

Thanks,

Nicholas Zimmer
Technical Support Engineer Tier II

Sorry for longer than planned delay.

I have completed testing. We can modify the SA_AIC_Resources table

So if its 1 to 1 move like shares aren't moving depth just moving servers but staying at the same level.

UPDATE sa_aic_resources
SET Value = REPLACE(Value, '\NZIMMER-FS', '\New nzimmer-fs')
WHERE Value LIKE '\NZIMMER-FS%';

This will work.

Now if some shares end up in different depths we will have to know the updated path and edit our script.
 

Thanks,

Nicholas Zimmer

As far as the AIC reviews are concerned we need to see how the SA_AIC_Resources table is set up.The UNC paths on the resource, if they will remain the same, will still work fine post migration.

Hi Jason and Corey,

1) Our Tier 2 TSE would like to review your environment.

2) As long as the node name is the same we could keep things going (when switching from one data center to the new one) but if you migrate and rename (or re-point to a new URL?), it will be treated as a new server and there isn't a reasonable way to migrate our data from one name to the new name. 
We could retain the old data then drop it when the new name has enough data.

3) We can try to collect once a week, but don't advise that due to how long it may take to import but this depends on the environment.
Take this statement with a grain of salt as you are already doing this correct?
 

Below is a summary of our meeting today:

+++++
2025_0212: Meeting with Jason and Corey
+++++

1) Do we have any customers who are just scanning backup nodes (a 'passive node' that may be one day behind in data). The customer is asking if they can capture the activity data of a synched node - a passive node and not an active node. And they are switching from the active node to the passive node.

2) How does NEA handle a new URL switching from Westfield to Akron but it will be the same data? It is technically a new array but the same data. How does NEA handle that transition as their Akron data center has always had the same data as Westfield (but passive versus active) Currently Isilon does not scan the passive node right now at all.

The passive node is a day behind in terms of replication. It will be a new URL but all of the same data.

3) They scan once a week to capture all file activities.

+++++
Current data center configuration: 
+++++
Westfield, OH - Active Data Center - will be deactivated
Akron, OH - Passive Data Center -

+++++
Switching to or migration to:
+++++
Akron, OH - will become the new Active Data Center 
Pittsburgh, PA - will become the new Passive Data Center

Jason,

I have one more scenario to test to see if it is more efficient  however I did get it to work as is.

I have one ask of you whenever you know the Name of the new server.

This should be done when you can and at least a day prior to implementing the Activity monitor agent  on the New server.
Also disable the FSAC Collection. This will make the transition easier.

Steps and Screenshot below. If you want to meet to do this and discuss the next steps let me know. Otherwise after the new server is ready prior to the New Agent install for activity on the New server. Then We can implement part 2, in order to "move" our activity data from the old server to the new server

1. In NAM go to the Current FS. and Double click on the File output.
2. Go to the Additional properties tab.
3. Enter the name of the new server the way you will be updating host lists. So if you are using Netbios or FQDN with the current server it makes sense to do the same with the new server.
4. Hit OK.
[cid:image006.png@01DBA9F0.23F278E0]

Hello Jason,

I believe the DFS will behave just fine from my testing but I am having a hang up on getting the old data for Activity to cooperate.

I am going to try fresh tomorrow after going for circles for several hours throughout today, and am collaborating with another team that believes this should be doable.

I'll update on that front tomorrow.

Alternatively my question is: Why do we need to just move the activity over?

This is how it would play out going that route.
We can preserve the Activity of the current server by just no longer targeting it with NEA. And then we can purge whenever your retention settings dictate.
That data will remain in reports and AIC so you can Still review it. When looking at AIC you will have both servers listed.
If you are looking at Permissions or Current activity we look at the new server. If you want older Activity you look at the old server.

Any current reports could be filtered to only show current data.

If I am missing something please let me know, I'll still report on my further testing tomorrow.

Thanks,

Sorry for longer than planned delay.

I have completed testing. We can modify the SA_AIC_Resources table

So if its 1 to 1 move like shares aren't moving depth just moving servers but staying at the same level.

UPDATE sa_aic_resources
SET Value = REPLACE(Value, '\NZIMMER-FS', '\New nzimmer-fs')
WHERE Value LIKE '\NZIMMER-FS%';

This will work.

Hi Jason and Corey,

1) Our Tier 2 TSE would like to review your environment.

2) As long as the node name is the same we could keep things going (when switching from one data center to the new one) but if you migrate and rename (or re-point to a new URL?), it will be treated as a new server and there isn't a reasonable way to migrate our data from one name to the new name.
We could retain the old data then drop it when the new name has enough data.

3) We can try to collect once a week, but don't advise that due to how long it may take to import but this depends on the environment.
Take this statement with a grain of salt as you are already doing this correct?


Below is a summary of our meeting today:

+++++
2025_0212: Meeting with Jason and Corey
+++++

1) Do we have any customers who are just scanning backup nodes (a 'passive node' that may be one day behind in data). The customer is asking if they can capture the activity data of a synched node - a passive node and not an active node. And they are switching from the active node to the passive node.

2) How does NEA handle a new URL switching from Westfield to Akron but it will be the same data? It is technically a new array but the same data. How does NEA handle that transition as their Akron data center has always had the same data as Westfield (but passive versus active) Currently Isilon does not scan the passive node right now at all.

The passive node is a day behind in terms of replication. It will be a new URL but all of the same data.

3) They scan once a week to capture all file activities.

+++++
Current data center configuration:
+++++
Westfield, OH - Active Data Center - will be deactivated
Akron, OH - Passive Data Center -

+++++
Switching to or migration to:
+++++
Akron, OH - will become the new Active Data Center
Pittsburgh, PA - will become the new Passive Data Center



Thank you,
Mike Candon
Senior Technical Support Engineer
